sect1.title: Enter a new bug
sect1.para: You found a bug, or somebody else found a bug and you decided to add it to Bugzilla.

listitem.para: Select the proper Version. You most always will choose the SVN version. It doesn't make sense to report a bug against an old version if it's no longer in Subversion. If it is, then SVN is newer than a previously released stable book version. The versions are basically there only for people who don't edit the book and who want to report a bug against the book version they have.
Don't worry about Component, Platform, OS and Severity Those aren't used at the moment.

Select the Resolution Priority. Use your own judgement on how important fixing this bug is. If you're not sure just leave the default. Priorities are periodically re-evaluated and changed anyway (what may be P5 a month ago may be changed to a P1 now because it's finally time to fix it).
Select the Initial state. Only select UNCONFIRMED if you haven't checked the matter out yet and are only suspecting a bug. Otherwise, leave it as NEW
If you don't want to assign yourself to it right away, leave the Assigned To field blank. It'll be assigned to lfs-book@linuxfromscratch.org then, until a real editor changes that to himself.
Fill in the other fields as appropriate, Summary and Description are mandatory.
As the last step, click on the Commit button to commit your changes to the database. A log of this will be sent to the lfs-book mailinglist.
